host.name:
Hostname of the remote server. Set up your `~/.ssh/config` such that you can connect to the remote host by the name specified in this field.
e.g. `localhost` or `my_host1`
host.status: A switch controlling if you are going to use this host. When you would like to stop the submission temporarily, maybe due to maintenance of the server, set this field to `disabled`
host.work_base_dir:
The path to the work directory. The work directory is the place where jobs are executed. Please specify the directory dedicated to OACIS jobs.
e.g. `~/work`
host.mounted_work_base_dir: If the work base dir is directly accessible from OACIS, specify the path which is accessible from OACIS. Keep it empty unless you share the volume with the remote host.
host.max_num_jobs:
The maximum number of concurrent jobs. Jobs are queued until the number of running jobs becomes this number.
e.g. `10`
host.polling_interval:
Time interval to check the status of the computational host. With this interval, SSH connection is made to check the status.
e.g. `60`
host.min_mpi_procs: The available range of the number of MPI processes. If you specify a number out of this range when making a run, you will get an error.
host.min_omp_threads: The available range of the number of OpenMP threads.
host.executable_simulators: List of executable simulators on that host.
host.executable_analyzers: List of executable analyzers on that host.

simulator.name:
Name of the simulator. Only alphanumeric characters and underscore (‘_’) are available. Must be unique.
e.g. `my_great_simulator`
simulator.pre_process_script: Script executed at the computational host before the job. When no pre-process is necessary, leave it empty.
simulator.local_pre_process_script: Script executed at OACIS server before the job. When no local-pre-preprocess is necessary leave it empty.
simulator.command:
The command to execute the simulator. It is recommended to specify it by the absolute path or the relative path from the home directory.
e.g. `~/path/to/my_simulator.out`
simulator.print_version_command: The command to print the simulator version information to standard output. Leave it empty when you do not record the simulator version.
simulator.input_type:
How the input parameter is given to the simulator.
Argument: input parameters are given as command line arguments.
JSON: input parameters are given by `_input.json` file
simulator.support_mpi: Whether the simulator is an MPI parallel program or not. If you enable this option, you can specify the number of MPI processes when making a Run.
simulator.support_omp: Whether the simulator is an OpenMP parallel program or not. If you enable this option, you can specify the number of OpenMP threads when making a Run.
simulator.sequential_seed: Whether the random number seed is given randomly or in a sequential order for each ParameterSet.
simulator.description: A short explanation of the simulator. The explanation is displayed in the simulator's page. Markdown format is available.
simulator.executable_on: Specify the hosts on which the simulator can be executed. You can select one of these as the computational host when making a Run.

analyzer.name: Name of the analyzer. Only alphanumeric characters and underscore (‘_’) are available. Must be unique within in each simualtor.
analyzer.type: Select `on_run` for a Run-Analyzer. Select `on_parameter_set` for a PS-Analyzer.
analyzer.pre_process_script: Script executed at the computational host before the job. When no pre-process is necessary, leave it empty.
analyzer.local_pre_process_script: Script executed at OACIS server before the job. When no local-pre-preprocess is necessary leave it empty.
analyzer.command:
The command to execute the analyzer. It is recommended to specify it by the absolute path or the relative path from the home directory.
e.g. `~/path/to/my_simulator.out`
analyzer.print_version_command: The command to print the simulator version information to standard output. Leave it empty when you do not record the simulator version.
analyzer.input_type:
How the input parameter is given to the simulator.
Argument: input parameters are given as command line arguments.
JSON: input parameters are given by `_input.json` file
analyzer.files_to_copy: Specify the files to be copied to `_input/` directory by a pattern. The pattern is used by `Dir.glob` method of Ruby. The default value is the wild card `*`, indicating that all the files are copied by default.
analyzer.support_mpi: Whether the analyzer is an MPI parallel program or not. If you enable this option, you can specify the number of MPI processes when making a Run.
analyzer.support_omp: Whether the analyzer is an OpenMP parallel program or not. If you enable this option, you can specify the number of OpenMP threads when making a Run.
analyzer.auto_run: If this is set, the analyzer is executed automatically each time a Run is finished.
analyzer.description: A short explanation of the analyzer. The explanation is displayed in the simulator's page. Markdown format is available.
analyzer.executable_on: Specify the hosts on which the simulator can be executed. You can select one of these as the computational host when making a Run.
analyzer.host_for_auto_run: The host to which analyzers made by "auto-run" is submitted.
